jobs.title: Graphic Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Graphic Designer

About Fizz

Fizz is the go-to social platform for Gen Z to connect with their community. College Fizz communities feature a private, moderated feed of anonymous posts from verified students, making it the most entertaining and authentic way to experience student life. On Global Fizz, all of Gen Z can connect across their shared experiences and identities.

Users can ask questions, share memes, post polls, and direct message others—all while keeping control of their identity. Safety, inclusion, and authenticity are core to everything we build.

Founded by two Stanford dropouts, Fizz launched at Stanford in 2021 and quickly reached over 95% student adoption. Since then, we've expanded to 400+ colleges, started generating ad revenue, and raised >$40M from investors such as Lightspeed, NEA, and Owl. Our mission: build a social network for the 99% of life that doesn’t make it onto entertainment platforms like Instagram and TikTok.

Where We’re Headed

In 2025, we’re focused on:

  • Expanding to every U.S. college

  • Accelerating revenue through new product iterations

  • Expanding Fizz to new markets beyond college, leveraging the new version of the Fizz product - Global Fizz

What You’ll Do

You’ll be a key creative on the Growth team, helping to define how Fizz connects with current and future users. Responsibilities include:

  • Design graphics for campus launches, social media, giveaways, and ads

  • Produce and edit video content for social campaigns and launches

  • Collaborate with the Head of Product, CEO, and Growth team on go-to-market strategies

  • Help shape and evolve the Fizz brand identity

  • Support the Product team with visual assets and mockups

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of experience in a graphic design role (bonus if you’ve worked in a fast-paced startup or media environment)

  • Strong eye for design, motion, and storytelling

  • Deep knowledge of Gen-Z culture, social platforms, and trends

  • Experience with video editing tools (e.g. Adobe Premiere, After Effects)

  • Great communication skills and ability to work across teams

  • Passion for social media and viral content

Compensation range for this role is between $70,000 to $100,000 per year, depending on job related skills and experience. At Fizz, full-time employees are eligible for company sponsored benefits and equity.

Our ideal candidate will be available to be onsite 5 days per week in our NYC office.

[Relocation packages available for the right candidate]

jobs.descriptionHtml:
iOS Engineer

About Fizz

Fizz is the go-to social platform for Gen Z to connect with their community. Since then, we've expanded to 400+ colleges, started generating ad revenue, and raised >$40M from investors such as Lightspeed, NEA, and Owl. Our mission: build a social network for the 99% of life that doesn’t make it onto entertainment platforms like Instagram and TikTok.

This position is an onsite role based out of our New York City office. Relocation assistance may be available for the right candidate.

Where We’re Headed

In 2025, we’re focused on:

  • Expanding to every U.S. college

  • Accelerating revenue through new product iterations

  • Expanding Fizz to new markets beyond college, leveraging the new version of the Fizz product - Global Fizz

Responsibilities

  • Lead the development of new UI features and functionality for Fizz’s iOS app (SwiftUI / UIKit), from conception to deployment

  • Build quickly and iterate often—take ideas from zero to one and ship them to hundreds of thousands of daily active users

  • Collaborate closely with backend engineers and dive into backend systems as needed to ensure seamless end-to-end product functionality

  • Design, build, and maintain core app infrastructure and shared components to support scalable and maintainable product development

  • Set up tools and processes that promote fast, high-quality software development and strong engineering culture

Qualifications

  • Strong experience with Swift, SwiftUI, and UIKit

  • Demonstrated ability to build and ship production-quality iOS apps from 0 to 1, ideally in a startup or fast-paced environment

  • Experience working with RESTful APIs, and comfort collaborating with backend engineers—or contributing directly to backend code when needed

  • Understanding of core iOS platform concepts, such as app lifecycle, data persistence, concurrency, and performance optimization

  • Awareness of common security and privacy best practices from a developer perspective

  • Strong product intuition and a pulse on Gen Z user behavior—able to build features that are both delightful and impactful

Compensation range for this role is between $120,000 - $200,000 a year based on job related skills and experience. Fizz full-time employees are eligible to receive company sponsored benefits and equity.

Our ideal candidate will be available to be onsite 5 days per week in our NYC office.

[Relocation packages available for the right candidate]

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Backend Engineer

About Fizz

Fizz is the go-to social platform for Gen Z to connect with their community. College Fizz communities feature a private, moderated feed of anonymous posts from verified students, making it the most entertaining and authentic way to experience student life. On Global Fizz, all of Gen Z can connect across their shared experiences and identities.

Users can ask questions, share memes, post polls, and direct message others—all while keeping control of their identity. Safety, inclusion, and authenticity are core to everything we build.

Founded by two Stanford dropouts, Fizz launched at Stanford in 2021 and quickly reached over 95% student adoption. Since then, we've expanded to 400+ colleges, started generating ad revenue, and raised >$40M from investors such as Lightspeed, NEA, and Owl. Our mission: build a social network for the 99% of life that doesn’t make it onto entertainment platforms like Instagram and TikTok.

Where We’re Headed

In 2025, we’re focused on:

  • Expanding to every U.S. college

  • Accelerating revenue through new product iterations

  • Expanding Fizz to new markets beyond college, leveraging the new version of the Fizz product - Global Fizz

What you’ll be doing

Our engineering team is lean, and we heavily value ownership and autonomy. Specifically, some of the things you can expect to work on include:

  • Owning end-to-end technical development of large product features that must scale to millions of users

  • Applying emerging technology such as LLMs and vector databases to novel product use cases like content recommendation and content moderation

  • Collaborating with our product lead and product designer to create user-friendly experiences

  • Working directly with our growth team to automate user acquisition and evangelize an engineering-driven mindset across the company

  • Actively setting up new tools and infrastructure to improve our team’s output

Qualifications

  • 2-7 years of experience of relevant backend development experience

  • Direct experience building products from 0-1 

  • Hands-on experience with TypeScript/NodeJS

  • Strong understanding of cutting-edge backend technologies, including API design, database optimization (SQL/NoSQL), secure data handling, and horizontally scaling infrastructure in cloud environments

  • Experience working in startup-like environments where ambiguities, shifting requirements, and iterative development is common

  • Strong engineering intuition: Learn fast, be adaptable 

  • Extreme hunger to take ownership and actively drive engineering initiatives

  • Eager to learn new skills at a fast pace and empower team members by sharing acquired knowledge

  • Strong grasp on product and ability to intuitively develop features that Gen-Z will use and love.

Bonus Points

  • Experience working with consumer-user-facing products.

  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform or MongoDB

  • iOS development experience, or experience working on the backend for a mobile application

Compensation range for this role is between $140,000 - $200,000 a year based on job related skills and experience. Fizz full-time employees are eligible to receive company sponsored benefits and equity.

Our ideal candidate will be available to be onsite 5 days per week in our NYC office.

[Relocation packages available for the right candidate]

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What is Fizz

Fizz is the dominant social platform for Gen-Z to connect with their immediate communities. Each Fizz community has a private and moderated feed of anonymous posts, authored by verified students at their school, providing the most entertaining, relatable, and interesting conversations about student life.

Students can post questions, memes, polls, and chat with other verified students while maintaining control over their identity and privacy. Fizz communities prioritize safety, authenticity, and inclusion through community-based moderation.

Founded by two Stanford dropouts, Fizz is currently expanding across colleges and high schools across the US with a mission to redefine the “social network” in a time when legacy platforms lack authenticity and are filled with curated highlight reels.

What we’ve done

We first launched Fizz at Stanford in July 2021 and have since seen >95% of undergraduates join the app, half of which use Fizz every day. Since raising a $25M Series B in July 2023, we have established ourselves as the dominant community platform at 350+ colleges, have begun to generate revenue through partnerships, and are actively expanding to communities beyond college.

Where we’re going

We have three primary goals for 2025: continue our expansion to the entire US college market, drive revenue growth through continuous product iteration, and build product to expand our user base and become the dominant social platform for all of Gen-Z, not just US college students.

What you’ll be doing

We’re seeking a Growth Engineer to build the systems and automations that power Fizz’s expansion, monetization, and operational efficiency. In this role, you’ll sit at the intersection of product, engineering, and go-to-market — working directly with our Head of Product, CTO, CEO, growth, and monetization teams.

You’ll own high-leverage projects across GTM, content management, trust & safety, and monetization, designing systems that eliminate manual work and accelerate our growth.

Specifically, your responsibilities will include:

  • Build systems that drive growth: Design and maintain the internal tools, workflows, and automations that power Fizz’s GTM engine, from onboarding flows to campus launch execution.

  • Enable operational excellence: Collaborate with ops and trust & safety teams to identify recurring issues, ship quick fixes, and deliver scalable solutions that improve efficiency and reduce pain points.

  • Turn data into leverage: Own analytics pipelines, dashboards, and reporting. Write SQL queries, track performance metrics, and ensure teams have accurate and actionable insights.

  • Automate the unglamorous stuff: From internal content workflows to systems that manage performance of 500+ Instagram page managers on campus, take on critical but messy challenges that unlock scalability.

  • Requirements shaping: You don’t just wait for specs — you proactively talk to ops, growth, and product teams to uncover problems, scope opportunities, and define what should be built.

  • Experiment and ship quickly: Prototype Retool apps or lightweight internal tools while also partnering with engineering to design long-term, production-grade systems.

  • Be accountable for outcomes: Your work directly impacts Fizz’s ability to expand faster, monetize smarter, and operate more efficiently.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in software engineering or growth engineering roles

  • Proven track record of building technical systems or products from 0→1 in fast-paced environments

  • Strong familiarity with architecting backend stacks and building in cloud environments (GCP, AWS, Azure)

  • Exceptional communication skills to translate between technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • Highly data-driven, with the ability to dive deep into analytics while also shaping strategic outcomes

  • Comfort moving between scrappy prototyping and long-term systems thinking

  • Strong grasp on the psychology of social products and a passion for building authentic experiences for Gen-Z

The primary technologies we work with are Swift, Node, Google Cloud, BigQuery, Mixpanel, and Retool — but prior experience with these specific technologies is not required.

The targeted compensation range for this role is between $120,000 - $170,000 a year based on job related skills and experience. Fizz full-time employees are eligible to receive company sponsored benefits and equity.

Our ideal candidate will be available to be onsite 5 days per week in our NYC office.

[Relocation packages available for the right candidate]

We first launched Fizz at Stanford in July 2021 and have since seen >95% of undergraduates join the app, half of which use Fizz every day. Since raising a $25M Series B in July 2023, we have established ourselves as the dominant community platform at 350+ colleges, have begun to generate revenue through partnerships, and are actively expanding to communities beyond college.

Where we’re going

We have three primary goals for 2026: continue our expansion to the entire US college market, drive revenue growth through continuous product iteration, and build product to expand our userbase and become the dominant social platform for all of Gen-Z, not just US college students.

As a Fizz intern, you will be able to use your own experience of being a Fizz user to directly build for a product you care about. We aim to give our engineering interns the same responsibilities and autonomy as full-time engineers, and you'll be responsible for owning large initiatives end-to-end. If this type of experience excites you, this internship will be a great fit.

Interns will work full-time out of our NYC office and receive a housing stipend + financial compensation.

Your Responsibilities

  • Imagine, design, deploy, and iterate new product features end-to-end (example projects include building advanced systems that use LLMs to moderate content, architecting a content recommendation system to improve the Fizzin feed, building new product features like campus events or job postings, and much more).

  • Write clean, efficient, and scalable code that meets project requirements.

  • Design and implement RESTful APIs that are scalable, reliable, and secure.

  • Work closely with senior engineers to support ongoing projects and tasks.

Qualifications

  • Be a current or graduating college student that is personally a user of Fizz.

  • Strong fundamentals of CS concepts such as Algorithms, Data Structures, Networking, Operating Systems, Databases.

  • Experience building several products from 0-1

  • Direct experience with any area of our tech stack (Swift, Google Cloud Platform, Typescript, Node JS)
